properties.headline: Flood Advisory issued February 10 at 11:06PM EST until February 11 at 1:00PM EST by NWS Greenville-Spartanburg SC
properties.description:
...The Flood Advisory continues for the Tuckasegee River...

...at Bryson City affecting Swain County

Forecasted storm-total rainfall of 2-5 inches across the Tuckasegee River
will occur over saturated soils through early Tuesday afternoon. The
Tuckasegee River is still elevated following heavy rainfall late last
week, therefore, the forecasted rainfall will cause yet another round of
significant rises along the Tuckasegee River. Nuisance flooding of
low-lying areas adjacent to the river from the Oconaluftee confluence
near Ela to Bryson City to Fontana Lake are expected to begin
overnight Monday and may persist into Tuesday evening.  More significant
river rises are possible so concerned residents are encouraged to follow
the latest forecasts and product updates for the latest information.

The Flood Advisory is extended for
the Tuckasegee River At Bryson City
* until Tuesday afternoon.
* At 10 PM Monday the stage was 6.0 feet and rising steadily.
* Action Stage is 8.0 feet.
* Minor Flood Stage is 10.0 feet.
* FORECAST: The river will rise to near 9.5 feet by Tuesday evening.
* IMPACTS: At 10.0 feet: Low lying areas between Bryson Walk and the
river will flood. Upstream between Main Street and the river, low
lying areas including parts of the Bear Hunter Campground will
flood.
* IMPACTS: At 8.0 feet: River will overflow its banks and will begin
to move into the Bear Hunter Campground near Bryson City.
properties.instruction:
The latest stages and forecasts for rivers can be found on our web
page at http://water.weather.gov/ahps2/index.php?wfo=gsp

A Flood Advisory for a river forecast point means that nuisance
flooding is expected to occur along the river when the river level is
forecast to be just below or at the official Minor Flood Stage.
